mdRecord.dcterms:title: Norfolk Borough, April 24, 1838. : Sir: At a recent meeting of the people of this Borough, resolutions were adopted by them, respectfully recommending to their fellow citizens of Virginia and North Carolina to unite with them in a Convention, to be holden in the city of Richmond on the second Wednesday in June next, with a view to aid in the attainment of the objects specified in the report and resolutions adopted at the last session of the Augusta Convention. : ... we have been appointed a committee to correspond with the counties and towns in those states, and to extend to them a most respectful and earnest invitation to meet us ...
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Commercial associations
Commerce
